title: Rise Festival 2025 Rises Above Night 1 Weather Issues for an Elevated Desert Weekend With R√ºf√ºs du Sol, Calvin Harris & John¬†Mayer
summary: Happening on a dry lakebed outside Las Vegas from Oct. 3-5, the festival overcame early challenges to host a lineup of stars and a genuinely special lantern release.
body: As Stone Temple Pilots once said, so much depends on the weather. On Friday in the Mojave Desert, roughly 30 miles southwest of Las Vegas, Rise festival learned this the hard way, which is to say the weather did not cooperate. High winds and attendant dust forced Rise organizers to open the gates almost three hours late, with the night’s set times subsequently shuffled and the evening‚Äôs centerpiece event ‚Äî the release of thousands of paper lanterns into the sky ‚Äî canceled entirely. Meanwhile, reports of hourslong wait times for attendees arriving from the Vegas Strip by shuttle, plus sparse food options, were posted on social media by many incensed pass holders in the time during and after night 1. The internet pile-on was swift and harsh, and the vibe on the grounds Friday night was, in many moments, challenging. The wind and dust got in eyes and nostrils, for many necessitating face masks, with chilly winds adding a bite to the air. Some waited in long lines for drinks and food while others (like us) sailed right up with no problem. As many in the crowd stood protecting their eyes while standing amid hundreds of unlit torches, reminding us that the night’s core activ‚Ä¶

title: BLACKPINK‚Äôs JISOO Teases Surprise Duet With Zayn Malik: ‚ÄòTwo Voices, One¬†Orbit‚Äô
summary: Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINK‚Äôs New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai.
body: BLACKPINK ‚Äôs JISOO has hinted at the release of a surprise duet this month. On Monday (Oct. 6), she unveiled a mysterious teaser image on social media, featuring a shadowed male silhouette standing behind her, with the word ‚ÄúEYESCLOSED‚Äù written across the frame ‚Äî suggesting an upcoming collaboration. “A duet is near,” the caption reads. A second post brought the shadowed male closer to the forefront, with the caption: “two voices, one orbit. coming soon.” The mysterious collaborator has been revealed to be Zayn Malik , a former member of One Direction. In the teaser, JISOO stands in the foreground while the male figure looms behind her ‚Äî his back turned, adding intrigue to the release. Zayn was previously seen attending BLACKPINK‚Äôs New York concert on July 27, accompanied by his daughter, Khai. After the show, he shared a photo from the audience with the caption: ‚Äú@BLACKPINKOFFICIAL THANK YOU üôÇ ME & KHAI LOVED IT,‚Äù sparking curiosity about the connection between the two artists. The upcoming duet will mark JISOO‚Äôs first new music release since her solo EP Amortage  in February, which featured tracks like ‚ÄúEarthquake,‚Äù ‚ÄúYour Love‚Äù and ‚ÄúHugs & K‚Ä¶

title: AEG Signs Landmark Deal to Run U.K. Venues on ‚ÄòDeep Green¬†Energy‚Äô
summary: The O2 in London and other venues are included in the initiative.
body: AEG Europe announced a landmark agreement on Tuesday (Oct. 7) that will make its U.K. venues the first to run on the country‚Äôs greenest energy. The European subsidiary of the global live entertainment promoter AEG has collaborated with green energy company Ecotricity on the agreement, which includes the introduction of PPAs (Power Purchase Agreements) with a 100% renewable energy supply, and is backed by hourly-matched REGOs (Renewable Energy Guarantees of Origin). Related The O2’s Steve Sayer on Running a Global-Leading Venue, Setting Green Standards and The BRITs Moving to Manchester Sylvan Esso Is Pulling Its Catalog From Spotify How Blond:ish Plans to Eliminate 42 Tons of Waste From NYC Nightlife Every Year: 'This Is My Passion' The PPAs will allocate specific renewable energy assets to a number of AEG‚Äôs venue portfolio in the U.K. including The O2 in London, indigo at The O2, Eventim Apollo, Watford Colosseum and University of Wolverhampton at The Halls. As a result, these venues will operate predominantly on the deepest green energy generated by solar and hydro assets and meet audit-level scrutiny and transparency standards. ‚ÄúPPAs are widely recognised a‚Ä¶

title: GLAAD eBay Auction Includes Swag Signed by Adam Lambert, Sam Smith, Barbra Streisand &¬†More
summary: And it's all for a good cause.
body: Want some Barbra Streisand vinyl, signed by the legendary diva herself? Or an autographed NASA jacket from the Queen + Adam Lambert tour, signed by the onetime American Idol contestant? How about signed swag and a meet & greet with KATSEYE , Sam Smith , Brandy & Monica , Chelsea Handler or Atsuko Okatsuka? Here‚Äôs your chance. GLAAD ‚Äì the world’s largest LGBTQ media advocacy organization ‚Äì has announced an eBay auction of celebrity swag in honor of #SpiritDay. 100% of the proceeds will benefit GLAAD in support of their mission to accelerate acceptance for the LGBTQ community. Launching globally Monday (Oct. 6) and running through Oct. 16 at eBay.com/glaad , the auction will give fans the opportunity to bid on one-of-a-kind items and experiences from celebrity GLAAD supporters. Auction items include: Adam Lambert: Autographed NASA Jacket from the 2019 Queen + Adam Lambert Rhapsody Tour in Houston. Atsuko Okatsuka: Two tickets + meet & greet to see Atsuko Okatsuka on The Big Bowl Tour. Barbra Streisand: Signed vinyl of The Secret of Life: Partners, Volume Two . Brandy & Monica: Two tickets + meet & greet to see the R&B stars on The Boy Is Mine Tour. Chel‚Ä¶

title: Chandler Moore & Naomi Raine Announce Exit From Maverick City Music: ‚ÄòGod‚Äôs Not Done¬†Yet‚Äô
summary: The worship music collective Maverick City Music is known for songs including "Jireh."
body: Two of Grammy-winning worship collective Maverick City Music ‘s members, Chandler Moore and Naomi Raine, have announced their departures from the group. On Monday (Oct. 6), both artists released statements on social media, revealing their decisions to exit the group. Each artist also emphasized that they will continue to make music outside of Maverick City Music. Related Maverick City Music‚Äôs Chandler Moore Scores First Gospel Airplay No. 1 on His Own With ‚ÄòLead Me On‚Äô This Taylor Swift 'The Fate of Ophelia' x 'Napoleon Dynamite' Dance Edit Is Actually Perfect Taylor Swift's 'The Fate of Ophelia' Video Is Finally Up on YouTube: Watch “These last two years I’ve been locked in on what really matters…in my life and my career,” Moore wrote on social media. “It’s been scary at times, but it’s also been full of fresh vision and real excitement about the future. With that, I’ve made the bittersweet decision to end my relationship with Maverick City Music. When we started Mav, I was grateful to have community and belonging while fulfilling my dream of making music that would help people experienc‚Ä¶

title: Central Cee Scores His First No. 1 on Rap & Rhythmic Airplay Charts With ‚ÄòWhich One‚Äô ‚Äî As Drake Extends Records for Most of All¬†Time
summary: Drake strings together his fourth No. 1 in a row on Rhythmic Airplay, all coming in 2025.
body: Drake ‚Äôs 43rd No. 1 on Billboard ‚Äôs Rhythmic Airplay chart is courtesy of his Central Cee collaboration ‚ÄúWhich One,‚Äù which lifts 2-1 on the tally dated Oct. 11. With ‚ÄúWhich One,‚Äù Drake strings together his fourth No. 1 in a row on the list — all coming in 2025. ‚ÄúNokia‚Äù reigned for two weeks in May, followed by the PARTYNEXTDOOR and Cash Cobain collaboration ‚ÄúSomebody Loves Me‚Äù in July for a week and the three-week rule of ‚ÄúWhat Did I Miss?‚Äù beginning in August. That run equals Drake‚Äôs longest streak of rulers on Rhythmic Airplay. He previously went four in a row between 2018 and 2019, albeit largely as a featured act on Bad Bunny ‚Äôs ‚ÄúMIA‚Äù and Meek Mill ‚Äôs ‚ÄúGoing Bad‚Äù and Chris Brown ‚Äôs ‚ÄúNo Guidance,‚Äù followed by a lead-act reign of his own via ‚ÄúMoney in the Grave,‚Äù featuring Rick Ross . It‚Äôs also Drake‚Äôs fourth nonconsecutive calendar year with at least four No. 1s, as well as his first with four or more No. 1s as a lead act since 2016. His 43rd No. 1 extends his record for the most Rhythmic Airplay toppers in the chart‚Äôs 33-year history. Most No. 1s, Rhythmic Airplay: 43, Drake 17, Rihanna 16, The Weeknd 14, Chris Brown 13, Bruno Mars 13, Lil Wayne 13, Usher 12, Beyonce 12,‚Ä¶
